article_text:
In a Republican contest for conservative hearts, governors almost always best senators. For good reason.

New Jersey Gov. Chris Christie zeroed in on it Saturday night in his takedown of Florida Sen. Marco Rubio: As legislators competing for the highest executive post in the land, senators cannot point to achievements the way governors can.

As Republicans head into Tuesday’s New Hampshire primary, Mr. Christie might also have...

twitter.description: Main Street columnist Bill McGurn writes that in the GOP war for second or third place in the New Hampshire Republican primary, the governors running for president have given Donald Trump a pass.
twitter.title: Governors vs. Senators
